citation.article-title: Ferrimonas senticii sp. nov., a novel gammaproteobacterium isolated from the mucus of a puffer fish caught in Kaneohe Bay, Hawai'i
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ferrimonas senticii sp. nov.
Ferrimonas senticii (sen.ti.ci.i. N.L. gen. n. senticii of Sentic, named in honour of Sinisa Sentic for scientific and philosophical discussions).
Gram-negative rods, cell size around 1.7 μm in length and non-motile.
Circular colonies form on MA at 30 °C after 1–2 days.
NaCl is required for growth in a range of 1.7–7.0 % (w/v), with an optimum at 2.0 %.
Strain P2S11T utilizes dl-lactic acid, acetic acid, Tween 80, inosine, uridine, thymidine and pyruvic acid methyl ester as carbon sources in the Biolog GN2 test.
Produces H2S on TSI+2 % NaCl agar.
The DNA G+C content is 54.9 mol%.
The predominant fatty acids are C16 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0 and C17 : 1ω8c.
The type strain, P2S11T (=ATCC BAA-1480T=DSM 18821T), was isolated from the slime of a puffer fish, Arothron hispidus, caught off the coast of the windward side of the island of O'ahu, Hawai'i.
